Package space.sunqian.common.io.communicate

Interface ChannelHandler<C extends ChannelContext<CH>,CH extends ByteChannel>

Type Parameters:
C - the type of the ChannelContext
CH - the type of the underlying channel
All Known Subinterfaces:
TcpServerHandler
public interface ChannelHandler<C extends ChannelContext<CH>,CH extends ByteChannel>
Handler for handling underlying channel events of IO Communication.

All callbacks triggered by events from the same underlying channel will use the same ChannelContext instance, ensuring consistent access to channel-specific state and attachments throughout the channel's lifecycle.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    channelClose(C context)
    This method is invoked after a channel is closed, and only once for each channel.

    This method is invoked after a new channel is opened, and only once for each new channel.
    void
    channelRead(C context)
    This method is invoked after a channel receives data.
    void
    exceptionCaught(C context, @Nonnull Throwable cause)
    This method is invoked after catching an unhandled exception, the exception may come from this handler or from the container running this handler.

  • Method Details

    • channelOpen

      void channelOpen(@Nonnull C context) throws Exception
      This method is invoked after a new channel is opened, and only once for each new channel.
      Parameters:
      context - the context for the new channel
      Throws:
      Exception - for any error

    • channelClose

      void channelClose(@Nonnull C context) throws Exception
      This method is invoked after a channel is closed, and only once for each channel.
      Parameters:
      context - the context for the closed channel
      Throws:
      Exception - for any error

    • channelRead

      void channelRead(@Nonnull C context) throws Exception
      This method is invoked after a channel receives data.
      Parameters:
      context - the context for the channel where the data is received
      Throws:
      Exception - for any error

    • exceptionCaught

      void exceptionCaught(@Nullable C context, @Nonnull @Nonnull Throwable cause)
      This method is invoked after catching an unhandled exception, the exception may come from this handler or from the container running this handler.

      The behavior is undefined if this method still throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      context - the context parameter of the method where this handler throws the exception, may be null if the exception is not thrown from this handler
      cause - the unhandled exception
